description: From a series of four etchings for the story "Der Rebell" by Manfred Georg, Heinrich Hochstim-Verlag, Berlin, 1918; full length image of a man on right side wearing a long coat and boots standing on a table; his intestines are exposed and falling from a large opening in his abdomen; in the lower left corner are the heads of three men; above the heads in the background are a number of smaller less defined figures coming toward the figures in the foreground
inscription: LLC of sheet in pencil, on verso: 12184 | LRC of sheet in pencil, on verso: 106.-
portfolio: From Plate 3 from Der Rebell (The Rebel), Manfred Georg, Heinrich Hochstim-Verlag, Berlin, 1918
signed: LR in pencil, below image: Walter Gramatté / 18 | LL in pencil, below image: Manfred Georg: der Rebell
title: Scene in the Cafe with the War-Wounded, Plate 3 from Der Rebell (The Rebel)
